translated: In Sanskrit:

analyzed: shr'i aa dzi t'a n'a tha s'a dha nam /
translated: Śrī-Ajitānāthāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal mi pham mgon po'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal mi pham mgon po'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
translated: The Means of Attaining the Glorious Ajita Protector

original: 'phags pa byams pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Maitreya.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug 'jig rten mgon //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug 'jig rten mgon //
translated: The lord of the ten stages, the protector of the world,

original: byams chan mi pham mgon po la //
analyzed: byams chan mi pham mgon po la //
translated: The loving Ajita, the protector,

original: phyag 'tshal nas ni rang dran phyir //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas ni rang dran phyir //
translated: Having paid homage, for the sake of remembering myself,

original: de yi sgrub thabs mdor bsdus bya //
analyzed: de yi sgrub thabs mdor bsdus bya //
translated: I will compose a concise means of attaining him.

original: dang por re zhig sngags pas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sngags pas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su 'dug ste /
translated: First, the mantra practitioner should sit in a place that is pleasing to the mind,

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pas legs par gnas par byas la /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pas legs par gnas par byas la /
translated: and abide well in pure conduct and the pure abodes.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom mo //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on all phenomena as emptiness.

original: de'i ngang la padma dang zla ba'i steng du bdag nyid yi ge meem gser gyi mdog can bltas la /
analyzed: de'i ngang la padma dang zla ba'i steng du bdag nyid yi ge meem gser gyi mdog can bltas la /
translated: Within that state, on a lotus and moon, one should visualize oneself as the syllable maim, the color of gold,

original: 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du song bas byang chub kyi klu shing gi bum pas mtshan par bsam mo //
analyzed: 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du song bas byang chub kyi klu shing gi bum pas mtshan par bsam mo //
translated: and imagine it marked by a bodhi tree and a water pot, preceded by the radiating and reabsorbing of light rays.

original: de yang snga ma ltar sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pas 'phags pa byams pa'i skur nye bar blta'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma ltar sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pas 'phags pa byams pa'i skur nye bar blta'o //
translated: Also, as before, by purifying the buddhafield, one should see oneself as the form of Ārya Maitreya.

original: de la 'phags pa byams pa gser btso ma'i mdog can /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa byams pa gser btso ma'i mdog can /
translated: There, Ārya Maitreya has the color of refined gold.

original: khru brgyad cu'i tshad mnga' ba mtshan bzang po yongs su dag pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: khru brgyad cu'i tshad mnga' ba mtshan bzang po yongs su dag pas brgyan pa /
translated: He is eighty cubits in size, adorned with the pure marks of a great being.

original: brtson pa'i cha byad 'gying bag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtson pa'i cha byad 'gying bag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the full splendor of the attire of an ascetic.

original: phyag g-yas chos 'chad dang / g-yon klu shing rgyas pa'i sdong bu ril bas mtshan pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas chos 'chad dang / g-yon klu shing rgyas pa'i sdong bu ril bas mtshan pa 'dzin pa /
translated: His right hand is in the teaching gesture, and his left hand holds a full-blown nāga tree branch marked with a water pot.

original: sku blta bas chog mi shes shing rang bzhin gyi 'ad  kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'phro ba ral pa'i chod pan can mdzes pa la /
analyzed: sku blta bas chog mi shes shing rang bzhin gyi 'ad  kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'phro ba ral pa'i chod pan can mdzes pa la /
translated: His body is delightful to behold, and his natural light radiates the maṇḍala of his body. He is adorned with a crown of hair and is beautiful.

original: mchod rten gyis ni gtsug tor spras //
analyzed: mchod rten gyis ni gtsug tor spras //
translated: His uṣṇīṣa is adorned with a stūpa.

original: tshangs skud dang ni phreng bas brgyan //
analyzed: tshangs skud dang ni phreng bas brgyan //
translated: He is adorned with a sacred thread and a garland.

original: snying gar pags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar pags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a skin at his heart.

original: de rdzas mgon po nyid bskul ba //
analyzed: de rdzas mgon po nyid bskul ba //
translated: He is invoked by the lord of substances himself.

original: dga' ldan nas ni ye shes dgug / dza:h'um bam ho:'i rig pa yis //
analyzed: dga' ldan nas ni ye shes dgug / dza:h'um bam ho:'i rig pa yis //
translated: From Tushita, one should summon the wisdom being with the knowledge of JAH HUM BAM HOH.

original: dam tshig la ni bstim par bya //
analyzed: dam tshig la ni bstim par bya //
translated: One should dissolve it into the pledge being.

original: de nas mchod sogs cho ga bzhin //🔽byams la snying rje chen po can //
analyzed: de nas mchod sogs cho ga bzhin // byams la snying rje chen po can //
translated: Then, one should make offerings and so forth according to the rite.

original: grub pa'i gsang sngags bzlas par bya //
analyzed: grub pa'i gsang sngags bzlas par bya //
translated: One should recite the mantra of the accomplished one, who is loving and greatly compassionate.

original: 'bum phrag bcus ni bsnyen pa @262a * //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcus ni bsnyen pa @262a * //
translated: One will accomplish it by reciting it one hundred thousand times.

original: 'grub // dngos dang rmi lam dag mthong la //
analyzed: 'grub // dngos dang rmi lam dag mthong la //
translated: One will see it in actuality or in a dream.

original: dga' ldan gzhal med bgrod pa dang // de yi phyag mtshan gnyis mthong ngam //
analyzed: dga' ldan gzhal med bgrod pa dang // de yi phyag mtshan gnyis mthong ngam //
translated: One will see the palace of Tushita and its two insignia,

original: mi pham rgyal tshab mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: mi pham rgyal tshab mthong gyur pa //
translated: or one will see Ajita, the regent.

original: de tshe de yi dri ma dag / chu bos bros nas zos pa yi //
analyzed: de tshe de yi dri ma dag / chu bos bros nas zos pa yi //
translated: At that time, one's defilements will be removed,

original: ljon shing bzhin du 'bad med par //
analyzed: ljon shing bzhin du 'bad med par //
translated: just as when a tree is uprooted and its roots are eaten by termites.🔽Without effort,

original: tshe 'di nyid la zad par byed //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la zad par byed //
translated: they will be exhausted in this very life.

original: aom meem mee tri mee tri yee sv'a h'a //🔽sgrub po gang zhig 'phags pa la //
analyzed: aom meem mee tri mee tri yee sv'a h'a // sgrub po gang zhig 'phags pa la //
translated: Om Maim Maitri Maitye Svaha.🔽The practitioner who has great faith in the noble ones,

original: dad pa mang dang 'gro la brtse //
analyzed: dad pa mang dang 'gro la brtse //
translated: who is compassionate to beings,

original: rtag tu smon lam yang ston pa //
analyzed: rtag tu smon lam yang ston pa //
translated: and who always teaches the aspiration

original: de dag rje btsun mdun du skye //
analyzed: de dag rje btsun mdun du skye //
translated: will be born in the presence of the venerable one.

original: dpal mi pham mgon po'i sgrub thabs /🔽slob dpon ni ri ti bas mdzad pa /
analyzed: dpal mi pham mgon po'i sgrub thabs / slob dpon ni ri ti bas mdzad pa /
translated: The Sadhana of Glorious Ajita-natha🔽composed by Acarya Nityarata

original: gnubs lo ts'a ba byams pa'i dpal gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: gnubs lo ts'a ba byams pa'i dpal gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: and translated by the Tibetan translator Byams-pa'i dpal.
